answers.answer: The same thing is happening to me I'm gonna ask my doc

Go to the dr, I'm 35w 4d and go to weekly appts, they ask me of any of those symptoms every time I go in, it can be a sign of preeclampsia which causes lack of blood flow to baby, definitely make an appt

That's weird I have had all kinds of problems with my vision just in the last two days. I called my doctor and they never got back to me so I went to Safeway to check my blood pressure and it was normal.

I go to the doctor every two weeks and never got asked that when they check my blood pressure it's fine and I've had blood work done over 5 times in this pregnancy so idk if it's anything too serious it's not like super blurry I just lose focus its like pregnancy brain to the fullest sorry if I didn't make that clear I wrote that when I was about to pass out me and baby got checked through blood and ultrasound like two weeks ago is it possible to still have preeclampsia

Your vision can change during pregnancy. It's one of those symptoms that happens to some, but not all. It can get much worse and usually goes back to normal. I got new contacts when I was pregnant with my first and they told me I'd probably have to get a new rx once he was born. I would tell your doctor about it though. Depending on the type of problems you're having with your vision it can be a sign of something else so it's good for you to get checked out.

question: before pregnancy I had great vision and now it's hard to focus on anything without it being blurry. Will my vision go back to normal after baby?
title: Blurred vision
